lines.gurmukhi: 1 mMglw crn
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: eykMkwru iekwNg iliK aUVw EAMkwru ilKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aykankaaru Ikaang Likhi Oorhaa Aoankaaru Likhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That homogenous supreme reality (God) ) first was written as numeral one mulmantr – the credal formula) and then He was inscribed as Ura syllable of Gurmukhi, further pronounced as Oankar.

lines.gurmukhi: siqnwm krqw purKu inrBau huie inrvYru sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satinaamu Karataa Purakhu Nirabhau Hoi Niravairu Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then He was called satinamu, the truth by name. Kartapurakh, the creator Lord, nirbhau, the fearless one, and Nirvair, withou rancour.

lines.gurmukhi: Akwl mUriq prqiK hoie nwau AjUnI sYBM BwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Akaal Moorati Paratakhi Hoi Naau Ajoonee Saibhan Bhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then emerging as the timeless akal murati to caIled as unborn and self-existent.

lines.gurmukhi: gurprswid su Awid scu jugh jugMqru hoNdw AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guraparasaadi Su Aadi Sachu Jougah Jougantari Hondaa Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Realized through the grace of Guru, the divine preceptor, the current of this primeval truth (God) has continuously moving since before the beginning and throughout the Ages.

lines.gurmukhi: hYBI hosI scu nwau scu drsx siqgurU idKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Haibhee Hosee Sachu Naau Sachu Darasanu Satiguroo Dikhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is verily the truth and will continue to be the truth for ever.

lines.gurmukhi: sbdu suriq ilvlIxu huie guru cylw prcw prcwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadu Surati Livaleenu Hoi Guru Chaylaa Parachaa Parachaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru has made available (for me) the glimpse of this truth.

lines.gurmukhi: guru cylw rhrwis kir vIh iekIh cVHwau cVHwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Chaylaa Raharaasi Kari Veeh Ikeeh Charhhaau Charhhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One who merging his iousness in the Word establishes a relationship of Guru and disciple, that disciple devoting himself to the Guru and progressing from worldliness attunes his consciousness in and with the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu AlK lKwieAw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaaiaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs had the glimpse of imperceptible Lord who is the fruit of delights

lines.gurmukhi: 2 pMj gurU

Shabad OS B.translation: Five Gurus

lines.gurmukhi: inrMkwru Akwr kir eykMkwru Apwr sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Nirankaaru Akaaru Kari Aykankaaru Apaar Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On assuming form that formless Lord was called as the boundless Ekankar.

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwru Akwru kir ieku kvwau pswau krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaaru Akaaru Kari Iku Kavaau Pasaau Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ekankar became Oankar whose one vibration spread as the creation.

lines.gurmukhi: pMj qq prvwx kir pMj imqR pMj sqR imlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Panj Tat Paravaanu Kari Panj Mitr Panj Satr Milaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then were created the five elements and five friends (truth, contentment and compassion etc.) and five enemies (the five evil propensities) of the creatures.

lines.gurmukhi: pMjy iqMn AswD swiD swDu sdwie swDu ibrdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Panjay Tini Asaadh Saadhi Saadhu Sadaai Saadhu Biradaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Man harnessed the incurable ailments of five evil propensities and three qualities of nature and maintained his virtuous reputation of being a sadhu.

lines.gurmukhi: pMjy eykMkwr iliK AgoN ipCIN shs PlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Panjay Aykankaar Likhi Agon Pichheen Sahas Phalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Five Gurus one after the other composed thousands of hymns, bat in praise of Ekankar.

lines.gurmukhi: pMjy AKr prDwn kir prmysru huie nwau DrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Panjay Akhar Paradhaan Kari Paramaysaru Hoi Naau Dharaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The bearer of fivelettered name, Nanak Dev, became prominent like God and was called Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur nwnk dyau hY gur AMgd AMghuN aupjwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Naanak Dayu Hai Guru Angadu Angahu Oupajaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: These Guru are the true Guru Nanak Dev who created Guru Angad out of his own limbs.

lines.gurmukhi: AMgd qy guru Amrpd AMmiRq rwm nwmu guru BwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Angad Tay Guru Amarapad Anmrit Raam Naamu Guru Bhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From Guru Angad, Guru Amar Das, the attainer of immortal status of Guru and from him getting the nectar name of the Lord, Guru Ram Das was loved by the people.

lines.gurmukhi: rwmdws guru Arjx CwieAw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Raamadaas Guru Arajan Chhaaiaa ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: From Guru Ram Das, like his shadow emerged Guru Arjan Dev

lines.gurmukhi: 3 gurU hirgoibMd

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Hargobind Sahib

lines.gurmukhi: dsqgIr huie pMj pIr hir guru hir goibMd Aqolw
lines.transliteration_english: Dasatageer Hui Panj Peer Hari Guru Hari Gobindu Atolaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The first five Gurus held the hands of the people and the sixth Guru Hargobind is incomparable God-Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: dIn dunI dw pwqswh pwqswhwN pwqswh Afolw
lines.transliteration_english: Deen Dounee Daa Paatisaahu Paatisaahaan Paatisaahu Adolaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is the king of spirituality as well as temporality and is in fact irremovable emperor of all the kings.

lines.gurmukhi: pMj ipAwly Ajru jir huie msqwn sujwx ivcolw
lines.transliteration_english: Panj Piaalay Ajaru Jari Hoi Masataan Sujaan Vicholaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Assimilating the unbearable knowledge of the earlier five cups (Gurus) in the inner core of his mind he re,mains merry and wise mediator for humanity.

lines.gurmukhi: qurIAw cViH ijix prmqqu iCA vrqwry kolo kolw
lines.transliteration_english: Tureeaa Charhhi Jini Paramatatu Chhia Varataaray Kolo Kolaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In spite of the six philosophies spread around, he reaching the turiyä (highest stage of meditation) has attained the supreme reality.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA drsn iCA pIVHIAwN ieksu drsnu AMdir golw
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Darasanu Chhia Peerhheeaan Ikasu Darasanu Andari Golaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He has strung all the six philosophies and their sects in the strung of one philosophy.

lines.gurmukhi: jqI sqI sMqoKIAwN isD nwQ Avqwr ivrolw
lines.transliteration_english: Jatee Satee Santokheeaan Sidh Naad Avataar Virolaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He has churned the essence of the lives of celebate ascetics, the followers of truth, contented people, the siddhs and naths (yogis) and the (so called) incarnations of God.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwrh rudR sumMdR ivic mir jIvy iqsu rqn Amolw
lines.transliteration_english: Giaarah Rudr Samound Vichi Mari Jeevai Tisu Ratanu Amolaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the eleven Rudrs remain in the ocean but those (divers) who seek life in death get the invaluable jewels.

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh solwN myl kir vIh iekIh cVHwau ihMfolw
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Solaan Mayl Kari Veeh Ikeeh Charhhaau Hindolaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the twelve zodiac sings of sun, sixteen phases of moon and numerous constellations have provided a beautiful swing for him.

lines.gurmukhi: AMqrjwmI bwlw Bolw ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Antarajaamee Baalaa Bholaa ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: This Guru is omniscient yet he possesses a childlike innocence.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 gurU crxodk mihmw

Shabad OS B.translation: The glory of the wash of the Guru feet

lines.gurmukhi: gur goivMd Kudwie pIr guru cylw cylw guru hoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Govindu Khudaai Peer Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guru Hoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Hargobind is the Lord in the form of Guru. Earlier a disciple he is now a. Guru i.e. earlier Gurus and Guru Hargobind are the same.

lines.gurmukhi: inrMkwr Awkwr kir eykMkwru Akwru pCoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Nirankaar Aakaaru Kari Aykankaaru Akaaru Paloaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: First, the formless Lord assumed the form of the Ekarikar and later he created all the forms (i.e. universe).

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwr Akwru lK lK drIXwau kryNdy FoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaari Akaari Lakh Lakh Dareeaau Karaynday Ddhoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the form of Oatikär (Guru) lacs of streams of life take shelter.

lines.gurmukhi: lK drIAwau smuMdR ivic sq smuMdR gVwV smoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Dareeaau Samoundr Vichi Sat Samoundr Garhaarhi Samoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lacs of rivers flow into seas, and all the seven seas merge in the oceans.

lines.gurmukhi: lK gVwV kVwh ivic qiRsnw dJih sIK proAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Garhaarhi Karhaah Vichi Trisanaa Dajhahi Seekh Paroaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the cauldron of desires of fire, the creatures of lacs of oceans hooked in skewers are getting roasted.

lines.gurmukhi: bwvn cMdn bUMd ieku TMFy qqy hoie KloAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baavan Chandan Boond Iku Tdaddhay Tatay Hoi Khaloaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All these burning creatures attain peace by the one drop of sandal-delight of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: bwvn cMdn lK lK crx kvl croxdk hoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baavan Chandan Lakh Lakh Charan Kaval Charanodaku Hoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: And lacs of such sandals have got created from the wash of the Guru's lotus feet.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHmu pUrn bHmu Awid purKu Awdysu AloAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Aloaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By the order of the transcendent, primeaval perfect God, the canopy

lines.gurmukhi: hirgoivMd gur CqR cMdoAw ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Harigovind Gur Chhatr Chandoaa ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: And the royal umbrella are held over the head of Guru Hargobind.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 aupkwrI mhwN purK

Shabad OS B.translation: Benevolent great men

lines.gurmukhi: sUrj dy Gir cMdRmw vYru ivroDu auTwvY kyqy
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraj Dai Ghari Chandramaa Vairu Virodhu Outdaavai Kaytai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When moon reaches the house of sun then (according to astrology) many enmities and oppositions erupt.

lines.gurmukhi: sUrj AwvY cMdR Gir vYru ivswir smwlY hyqy
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraj Aavai Chandri Ghari Vairu Visaari Samaalai Haytai.

Shabad OS B.translation: And if sun enters the house of moon, the enmity is forgotten and love emerges.

lines.gurmukhi: joqI joiq smwie kY pUrn prm joiq iciq cyqy
lines.transliteration_english: Jotee Joti Samaai Kai Pooran Param Joti Chiti Chaytai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukh, having established his identity with the supreme light, always cherishes that flame in his heart.

lines.gurmukhi: lok Byd guxu igAwnu imil iprm ipAwlw mjls Byqy
lines.transliteration_english: Lok Bhayd Gounu Giaanu Mili Piram Piaalaa Majalas Bhaytai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Understanding the mystery of the ways of the world, cultivating values and the knowledge of the Shastras, he quaffs the cup of love in the assembly (the holy congregation).

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruqI iCA drsnw ieku sUrju guru igAwnu smyqy
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Routee Chhia Darasanaan Iku Sooraju Gur Giaanu Samaytai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the six seasons are caused by one sun, similarly all the six philosophies are the result of the consolidated knowledge of the one Guru (the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: mjhb vrn sprs kir Ast Dwq ieku Dwqu su Kyqy
lines.transliteration_english: Majahab Varan Saparasu Kari Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaatu Su Khaytai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As eight metals mix to make one alloy, similarly meeting the Guru, all the vamas and sects turn out to be the followers of the way of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: nau Gr Qwpy nvYN AMg dsmwN suMn lMGwie Agyqy
lines.transliteration_english: Nau Ghar Daapay Navai Ang Dasamaan Sounn Laghaai Agaytai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nine limbs form nine separate houses, but only the tenth gate of tranquillity, leads further to liberation.

lines.gurmukhi: nIl AnIl Anwhdo inJru Dwir Apwr snyqy
lines.transliteration_english: Neel Aneel Anaahado Nijharu Dhaari Apaar Sanaytai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Understanding the void (Sany), Jiv becomes infinite like the numbers of nil and anti and enjoys impossible water fall of His love.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh AlyK lyK sMK AsMK n siqjug qRyqy
lines.transliteration_english: Veer Ikeeh Alaykh Laykh Sankh Asankh N Satijougu Traytai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then this jiv goes beyond the counts of twenty, twenty-one, millions or crores, innumerables, sad yugs, tretas yugs i.e. Jiv gets liberated from the time-cycle.

lines.gurmukhi: cwr vrn qMbol rs dyv kryNdw psU pryqy
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varan Tanbol Ras Dayv Karayndaa Pasoo Paraytai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the four ingredients in a betel become beautiful and homogenous, similarly this benevolent Guru, transforms animals and ghosts into gods.

lines.gurmukhi: Pkr dys ikauN imlY dmyqy ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Dhakar Days Kioun Milai Damaytai ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: How can this land of saintliness be procured by money and wealth.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 s`c sB qoN au`cw

Shabad OS B.translation: Everything is below truth)

lines.gurmukhi: cwir cwir mjhb vrn iCA drsn vrqY vrqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Chaari Majahab Varan Chhia Darasan Varatai Varataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The dealings of the four sects (of Muslims), four vamas (of Hindus) and the six schools of philosophy are current in the world.

lines.gurmukhi: isv skqI ivic vxj kir caudh ht swh vxjwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Sakatee Vich Vanaj Kari Chaudah Hat Saahu Vanajaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In all the shops of fourteen worlds, that great banker (the Lord God) is doing business in the form of Siva and Sakti, the all pervading cosmic law.

lines.gurmukhi: sc vxj guru htIAY swDsMgiq kIriq krqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Vanaju Guru Hateeai Saadhasangati Keerati Karataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true merchandise is available in the Guru's shop, the holy congregation, wherein praises and glory of the Lord are sung.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwn iDAwnismrn sdw Bwau Bgiq Bau sbdibcwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Giaan Dhiaan Simaran Sadaa Bhaau Bhagati Bhau Sabadi Bichaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Knowledge, meditation, remembrance, loving devotion and the fear of the Lord are always propounded and discussed there.

lines.gurmukhi: nwmu dwnu ienswnu diRV gurmuiK pMQ rqn vwpwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Drirh Guramoukhi Pandu Ratan Vaapaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs, who are steadfast in remembering the name of Lord, ablution and charity, make bargains of jewels (virtues) there.

lines.gurmukhi: praupkwrI siqgurU scKMif vwsw inrMkwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Paraoupakaaree Satiguroo Sach Khandi Vaasaa Nirankaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is benevolent and in his abode of truth, the formless Lord resides.

lines.gurmukhi: caudh ividAw soiDkY gurmuiK suK Plu scu ipAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaudah Vidiaa Sodhi Kai Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Sachu Piaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Practising all the fourteen skills, the gurmukhs have identified love towards the truth as the fruit of all delights.

lines.gurmukhi: schuN ErY sB ikCu aupir gurmuiK scu Awcwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachahu Aorai Sabh Kihu Oupari Guramoukhi Sachu Aachaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Everything is below truth but, for the gurmukhs truthful conduct is higher than the truth.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn vws vxwspiq guru aupdysu qrY sYNswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasapati Guru Oupadaysu Tarai Sainsaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the fragrance of sandal makes the whole vegetation fragrant, the whole world gets across through the teachings of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: Aipau pIA gurmiq husIAwrw ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Apiu Peea Guramati Houseeaaraa ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Drinking the nectar of the Guru's teaching, the Jiv becomes awake and alert.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 gurmuK ivc gurU vrqdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Among the gurmukhs pervades the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: AmlI soPI cwkrwN Awpu Awpxy lwgy bMny
lines.transliteration_english: Amalee Sodhee Chaakaraan Aapu Aapanay Laagay Bannai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Servants, addict as well as teetotaller, may be in the vicinity, but the minister

lines.gurmukhi: mhrm hoih vjIr so mMqR ipAwlw mUl n mMny
lines.transliteration_english: Maharam Hoi Vajeer So Mantr Piaalaa Mooli N Mannai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who knows ins and outs of the court never accepts their advice.

lines.gurmukhi: nw mihrm huisAwr msq mrdwnI mjls kir BMny
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Maharam Housiaar Masat Maradaanee Majalas Kari Bhannai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The ignorant one who tries to be clever or feigns indifference is expelled by the minister from the court.

lines.gurmukhi: qkrIrI qhrIr ivic pIr prsq murId aupMny
lines.transliteration_english: Takareeree Tahareer Vichi Peer Parasat Mureed Oupannai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In speaking and writing like this minister, loyal devoted disciples, have been created by the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq AlKu n lKIAY AmlI sUPI lgY n kMny
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Alakhu N Lakheeai Amalee Soodhee Lagani Kannai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those addicts, who have not had the glimpse of the Lord through the wisdom of the Guru, never associate with the teetotallers (the holy ones).

lines.gurmukhi: AmlI jwxin AmlIAwN soPI jwxin soPI vMny
lines.transliteration_english: Amalee Jaanani Amaleeaan Sodhee Jaanani Sodhee Vannai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The addicts are acquainted with addicts, likewise, teetotallers meet the teetotallers.

lines.gurmukhi: hyqu vjIrY pwiqswh duie KoVI ieku jIau isDMny
lines.transliteration_english: Haytu Vajeerai Paatisaah Doi Khorhee Iku Jeeu Sidhannai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The affection between a king and his minister is such as if the same one life current is moving in two bodies.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau smsyr imAwn ivic iekqu Qoku rhn duie KMny
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Samasayr Miaan Vichi Ikatu Dayku Rahani Dui Khannai.

Shabad OS B.translation: This relationship is also like the relation of the sword in the sheath; the two may be separate, yet they are one ( i.e. sword in sheath is yet called sword only).

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh ijvYN rs gMny ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Jivain Rasu Gannai ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise is the relation of gurmukhs with the Guru; they are subsumed in each other in such a manner as is the juice and the sugarcane.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 rsIey qy gRXwnI

Shabad OS B.translation: Devout gursikhs and vain scholars

lines.gurmukhi: cwkr AmlI soPIAwN pwiqswh dI caukI Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Chaakar Amalee Sodheeaan Paatisaah Dee Chaoukee Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Servants, addict (of the Lord's name) as well as teetotallers devoid of Mitn came to the Lord king's presence.

lines.gurmukhi: hwjr hwjrwN ilKIAin gYr hwjrwN gYr hwjr lwey
lines.transliteration_english: Haajar Haajaraan Likheeani Gair Haajar Gairahaajar Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those present are marked present and those absent are declared absent.

lines.gurmukhi: lwiek dy vIcwir kY ivrly mjls ivic sdwey
lines.transliteration_english: Laaik Day Vichaari Kai Viralai Majalas Vichi Sadaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The intelligent king (God) selected a few to be his courtiers.

lines.gurmukhi: pwiqswhu huisAwr msq Kus PihmI dovy prcwey
lines.transliteration_english: Paatisaahu Housiaar Masat Khous Dhahimee Dovai Parachaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He, a clever person, made both the clever and the indifferent happy and put them to work.

lines.gurmukhi: dyin ipAwly AmlIAwN soPI sB ipAwvx lwey
lines.transliteration_english: Dayni Piaalay Amaleeaan Sodhee Sabhi Peeaavanu Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now, the so called teetotallers (religious persons) were engaged to serve drinks (nam) to the addicts.

lines.gurmukhi: mqvwly AmlI huey pI pI cVHy sihj Gir jwey
lines.transliteration_english: Matavaalay Amalee Hoay Pee Pee Charhhay Sahaji Ghari Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The latter became exhilerated in the name of the Lord and attained tranquility

lines.gurmukhi: sUPI mwrin tkrwN pUj invwjy sIs invwey
lines.transliteration_english: Soodhee Maarani Takaraan Pooj Nivaajai Sees Nivaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the so-called religious persons (teetotallers who served mans to others) remained involved in the so-called prayer and ritualistic worship.

lines.gurmukhi: vyd kqyb Ajwb ivic kir kir KudI bhs bhswey
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Katayb Ajaab Vichi Kari Kari Khudee Bahas Bahasaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They under the tyranny of their religious books, the Vedas and the Katebas, kept busy in arrogant debates and discussions.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl ivrlw pwey ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Viralaa Paaay ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ny rare gurmukh attains the fruit of the delight (of quaffing the drink of Lord's name).

lines.gurmukhi: 9 rsIAwN ny gRXwnIAwN nUM dyxw qy gRXwnIAwN dI nwNh

Shabad OS B.translation: The devout offer joy to the vain scholars but they do not accept it

lines.gurmukhi: bhY JroKy pwiqswh iKVkI KoliH dIvwn lgwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bahai Jharokhay Paatisaah Khirhakee Kholhi Deevaan Lagaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The emperor (Lord) sitting in a window (holy congregation) gives audience to the people in a arranged court.

lines.gurmukhi: AMdir caukI mhl dI bwhir mrdwnw imil AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Andari Chaoukee Mahal Dee Baahari Maradaanaa Mili Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Inside gather the privileged persons but outside assemble the commoners.

lines.gurmukhi: pIAY ipAwlw pwiqswhu AMdir KwswN mhil iplwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Peeai Piaalaa Paatisaahu Andari Khaasaan Mahali Peelaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Emperor (Lord) Himself quaffes the cup (of love) and arranges to serve the select ones inside.

lines.gurmukhi: dyvn AmlI sU&IAwN Avl dom dyiK idKlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dayvani Amalee Soodheeaan Avali Dom Daykhi Dikhalaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Keeping in view the two categories of the likely addicts and the teetotallers (so-called religious persons) He Himself distributes the wine of love to them.

lines.gurmukhi: kry mnwh srwb dI pIAY Awpu n horu suKwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Karay Manaah Saraab Dee Peeai Aapu N Horu Soukhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The teetotaller (engaged in ritualism) neither drinks the wine of love himself nor allows others to drink.

lines.gurmukhi: auls ipAwlw imhr kir ivrly dyie n pCoqwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ulas Piaalaa Mihar Kari Viralay Dayi N Pachhotaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting pleased, that Lord goes on giving the cup of His grace to the rare ones and never regrets.

lines.gurmukhi: ikhu n vswvY ikhY dw gunh krwie hukmu bKswvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kihu N Vasaavai Kihai Daa Gounah Karaai Houkamu Bakhasaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: None is to blame, lie himself makes the creatures commit crime and himself pardons their sins in the hukam, the divine will.

lines.gurmukhi: horu nw jwxY iprm rs jwxY Awp kY ijsY jxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Horu N Jaanai Piram Rasu Jaanai Aap Kai Jisu Janaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: None else understands the mystery of the delight of His love; only He himself knows or the one whom He makes to know.

lines.gurmukhi: ivrly gurmuiK AlK lKwvY ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Viralay Guramoukhi Alakhu Lakhaavai ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Any rare gurmukh beholds the glimpse of that imperceptible Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 byAmlIAwN gRXwnIAwN dw hwl

Shabad OS B.translation: The condition of the non-addicts or hollow scholars

lines.gurmukhi: vyd kqyb vKwxdy sUPI ihMdU muslmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Katayb Vakhaanaday Soodhee Hindoo Mousalamaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Devoid of the love (of the Lord) Hindu and Muslim scholars describe the Vedas and the Katebas respectively.

lines.gurmukhi: muslmwx Kudwie dy ihMdU hir prmysuru Bwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Mousalamaan Khudaai Day Hindoo Hari Paramaysuru Bhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Muslims are men of Allah and the Hindus love Hari (Visnu), the supreme god. Muslims have faith in Kalima, the sacred formula of Muslims, sunnat,

lines.gurmukhi: klmwN suMnq isdk Dir pwie jnyaU iqlku suKwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Kalamaan Sounnat Sidak Dhari Paai Janayoo Tilaku Soukhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: And circumcision, and Hindus feel comfortable with the flak, sandal paste mark and the sacred thread, janett

lines.gurmukhi: mkw muslmwn dw gMg bnwrs dw ihMduvwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Makaa Mousalamaan Daa Gang Banaaras Daa Hinduvaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The pilgrimage centre of Muslims is Mecca and that of the Hindus Banaras situated on the bank of Ganges.

lines.gurmukhi: rojy riK inmwj kir pUjw vrq AMdir hYrwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Rojay Rakhi Nimaaj Kari Poojaa Varat Andari Hairaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The former undertake rozas, fasts, and namaz, prayer, whereas the latter feel ecstasy (in their worship and fasts).

lines.gurmukhi: cwir cwir mjhb vrn iCA Gir guru aupdysu vKwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Chaari Majahab Varan Chhia Ghari Guru Oupadaysu Vakhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They each have four sects or castes. Hindus have their six philosophies which they preach in every home.

lines.gurmukhi: muslmwn murId pIr guru isKI ihMdU loBwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Mousalamaan Mureed Peer Guru Sikhee Hindoo Lobhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Muslims have the traditions of Murids and Pirs

lines.gurmukhi: ihMdU ds Avqwr kir muslmwx ieko rihmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hindoo Das Avataar Kari Mousalamaan Iko Rahimaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whereas the Hindus love to ten incarnations (of God), the Muslims have their single Khuda, Allah.

lines.gurmukhi: iKMjoqwx kryin iD|wxw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Khinjotaanu Karayni Dhiaanaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: They both have in vain created many tensions.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 Kws AmlI rsIAwN dw hwl

Shabad OS B.translation: The condition of the special addicts

lines.gurmukhi: AmlI Kwsy mjlsI iprm ipAwlw AlKu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Amalee Khaasay Majalasee Piramu Piaalaa Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The special admirers gathered in the assembly (holy congregation), through the cup of love have beholden the imperceptible (Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: mwlw qsbI qoiV kY ijauN sau iqvYN AToqru lwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Maalaa Tasabee Torhi Kai Jiu Sau Tivai Atdotaru Laaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They break the restriction of beads (Muslim rosary) and for them the number of beads as hundred or one hundred and eight are immaterial.

lines.gurmukhi: myru iemwm rlwie kY rwmu rhImu n nwau gxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Mayru Imaamu Ralaai Kai Raamu Raheemu N Naaoun Ganaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They combine Meru (the last bead of Hindu rosary) and Imam (the last bead of Muslim roasary) and keep no distinction between Ram and Rahim (as names of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: duie imil ieku vjUdu huie caupV swrI joiV juVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dui Mili Iku Vajoodu Hui Chaouparh Saaree Jorhi Jurhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Joining together they become one body and consider this world as the game of oblong dice.

lines.gurmukhi: isv skqI no lMiG kY iprm ipAwly inj Gir AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Sakatee No Laghi Kai Piram Piaalay Nij Ghari Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Transcending the illusory phenomenon of the actions of Siva and his Sakti, they quaff the cup of love and stabilize in their own self.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjsu qwmsu swNqko qIno lMiG cauQw pdu pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Raajasu Taamasu Saatako Teeno Laghi Chaudaa Padu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Going beyond the three qualities of nature, the rajas, tamas and sattv, they attain the fourth stage of supreme equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: gurgoivMd Kudwie pIru gurisK pIru murIdu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Govind Khudaai Peeru Gurasikh Peeru Mureedu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru, Gobind and Khuda and Pir are all one, and the Sikhs of the Guru hold and know the inner truth of the Pir and Murid. i.e. the spiritual leader and the follower disciple.

lines.gurmukhi: scu sbd prgws kir sbd suriq scu scu imlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Sabad Paragaasu Kari Sabadu Surati Sachu Sachi Milaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Enlightened by the true word and merging their consciousness in the Word they absorb their own truth into the supreme truth.

lines.gurmukhi: scw pwiqswhu scu BwieAw ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Sachaa Paatisaahu Sachu Bhaaiaa ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: They love only the true emperor (Lord) and the truth.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 siqgurU invws, siqsMg ivc

Shabad OS B.translation: The abode of true Guru is the holy congregation ,

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHmu pUrn bHmu siqguru swDsMgiq ivic vsY
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Satiguru Saadhasangati Vichi Vasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is the transcendent perfect Brahm and resides in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq AwrwDIAY Bwie Bgiq BY shj ivgsY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadi Surati Araadheeai Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Sahaji Vigasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: By absorbing the consciousness in the Word He is adored, and cherishing love, devotion and His awe He spontaneously blooms in the heart.

lines.gurmukhi: nw Ehu mrY n sogu hoie dyNdw rhY n Bogu ivxsY
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Aohu Marai N Sogu Hoi Dayndaa Rahai N Bhogu Vinasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He never dies nor becomes sorrowful. He always goes on bestowing, and his bounties are never exhausted.

lines.gurmukhi: gurU smwxw AwKIAY swDsMgiq AibnwsI hsY
lines.transliteration_english: Guroo Samaanaa Aakheeai Saadh Sangati Abinaasee Hasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: People say that the Guru has passed away but the holy congregation smilingly accepts Him as indestructible.

lines.gurmukhi: CyvIN pIVHI gurU dI gurisKwN pIVI ko dsY
lines.transliteration_english: Chhayveen Peerhhee Guroo Dee Gur Sikhaa Peerhhee Ko Dasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru (Hargobind) is the sixth generation of Gurus but who can tell about the generations of the Sikhs.

lines.gurmukhi: scu nwauN scu drsno scKMf siqsMg srsY
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Naaoun Sachu Darasano Sachakhand Satisangu Sarasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The concepts of true name, true glimpse, and the true abode get their explanation only in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: iprm ipAwlw swDsMig Bgq vClu pwrsu prsY
lines.transliteration_english: Piram Piaalaa Saadhasangi Bhagati Vachhalu Paarasu Parasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cup of love is quaffed in the holy congregation and there only the touch of the philosopher's stone (Lord), loving to devotees is received.

lines.gurmukhi: inrMkwr Awkwr kir hoie Akwl AjonI jsY
lines.transliteration_english: Nirankaaru Akaaru Kari Hoi Akaal Ajonee Jasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the holy congregation, the formless one assumes form and there only the unborn, timeless

lines.gurmukhi: scw scu ksautI ksY ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Sachaa Sachu Kasaoutee Kasai ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Being is eulogized. The truth only prevails there and everyone is tested on the touchstone of truth there.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 siqsMg-scKMf hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Holy congregation is the abode of truth-

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwr Akwr kir qRY gux pMj qq aupjwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaar Akaaru Kari Trai Goun Panj Tat Oupajaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The supreme Reality assuming the form of Oankar created the three qualities (of matter) and the five elements.

lines.gurmukhi: bHmw ibsnu mhys swij ds Avqwr cilq vrqwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Saaji Das Avataar Chalit Varataaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Creating Brahma, Visnu and Mahes'a he performed the sports of ten incarnations.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruiq bwrh mwh kir sq vwr sYNswr aupwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Routi Baarah Maah Kari Sati Vaar Sainsaar Oupaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Producing six seasons, twelve months and seven days he created the whole world.

lines.gurmukhi: jnm mrn dy lyK iliK swsqR vyd purwx suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Janam Maran Day Laykh Likhi Saasatr Vayd Puraan Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Scribing the writs of birth and death, He recited the Vedas, Shastras and the Puranas.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq dw Awid AMq iQq n vwru n mwhu ilKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sangati Daa Aadi Antu Dit N Vaaru N Maahu Likhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: About the beginning and end of the holy congregation He did not prescribe any date, day or month.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq scuKMfu hY inrMkwr guru sbd vswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sangati Sachu Khandu Hai Nirankaaru Guru Sabadu Vasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Holy congregation is the abode of truth wherein resides the formless One in the form of Word.

lines.gurmukhi: ibrKhuN Pl Pl qy ibrK Akl klw kir AlKu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Birakhahu Phalu Phal Tay Birakhu Akal Kalaa Kari Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Creating fruit from tree and tree from fruit i.e. making disciple of the Guru and then from disciple the Guru, the Lord has laid down the mystery of His perfect imperceptible form.

lines.gurmukhi: Awid purKu Awdysu kir Awid purKu Awdysu krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Kari Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurus themselves bowed before the primeval Lord and made others also bow before Him.

lines.gurmukhi: purKu purwqnu siqgurU Eq poiq ieku sUqR bxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Purakhu Puraatanu Satiguroo Aotapoti Iku Sootr Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is the primordial Lord who is pervading this creation as does a thread in the rosary.

lines.gurmukhi: ivsmwdY ivsmwdu imlwieAw ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Visamaadai Visamaadu Milaaiaa ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Himself is the wonder who is one with the supreme wonder.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 bHmwN krq`v

Shabad OS B.translation: Actions of Brahma

lines.gurmukhi: bHmy idqy vyd cwr cwir vrn Awsrm aupjwey
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamay Ditay Vayd Chaari Chaari Varan Aasaram Oupajaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Brahma gave four Vedas and created four vamas and four stages of life (brahmchary, grihasth, vanaprasth and sannyas).

lines.gurmukhi: iCA drsn iCA swsqw iCA aupdys Bys vrqwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Darasan Chhia Saasataa Chhia Oupadays Bhays Varataaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He created the six phi­losophies, their six texts. teachings and their corresponding sects.

lines.gurmukhi: cwry kuMfwN dIp sq nau KMf dhidis vMf vMfwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chaaray Koundaan Deep Sat Nau Khand Dah Disi Vand Vandaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He dis­tributed the whole world into the four corners, seven continents, nine divi­sions and ten directions.

lines.gurmukhi: jl Ql vx KMf prbqwN qIrQ dyv sQwn bxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Dal Van Khand Parabataan Teerad Dayv Sadaan Banaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Water, earth, forests, mountains, pilgrimage cen­tres and the abodes of gods were created.

lines.gurmukhi: jp qp sMjm hom jg krm Drm kir dwn krwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jap Tap Sanjam Hom Jag Karam Dharam Kari Daan Karaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He made the traditions of recitations, ascetic discipline, continence, burnt offerings, rituals, worships, char­ity etc.

lines.gurmukhi: inrMkwru n pCwixAw swDsMgiq dsY n dswey
lines.transliteration_english: Nirankaaru N Pachhaaniaa Saadhasangati Dasai N Dasaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: None has identified the formless Lord, because only holy congre­gation explains about the Lord but none goes there to ask about Him.

lines.gurmukhi: suix suix AwKxu AwiK suxwey ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Souni Souni Aakhanu Aakhi Sounaaay ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: People talk and hear about Him only on the basis of heresay (no one moves on the way of experience).

lines.gurmukhi: 15 ivSnUM krq`v

Shabad OS B.translation: Actions of Visnu

lines.gurmukhi: ds AvqwrI ibsnu hoie vYr ivroD joD lVvwey
lines.transliteration_english: Das Avataaree Bisanu Hoi Vair Virodh Jodh Larhavaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: In his ten incarnations Visnu caused the opposing warriors fight each other.

lines.gurmukhi: dyv dwnv kir duie DVy dYq hrwey dyv ijqwey
lines.transliteration_english: Dayv Daanav Kari Dui Dharhay Dait Haraaay Dayv Jinaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He created two factions of gods and demons and out of them he helped the gods win and caused the defeat of demons.

lines.gurmukhi: mC kC vYrwh rUp nrisMG bwvn boD aupwey
lines.transliteration_english: Machh Kachh Vairaah Roop Nar Singh Baavan Baudh Oupaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He created incarnations in the forms of Fish, Tortoise, Varah (Boar), Narsingh (Man-lion), Vaman (Dwarf) and the Buddh.

lines.gurmukhi: prsrwm rwm kiRsnu hoie iklk klMkI nwau gxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Parasaraamu Raam Krisanu Hoi Kilak Kalakee Naau Ganaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The names of Pars'u Ram, Ram, Krsna, Kalki are also counted among his incarnations.

lines.gurmukhi: cMcl cilq pKMf bhu vl Clkir prpMc vDwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chanchal Chalit Pakhand Bahu Val Chhal Kari Parapanch Vadhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Through their deceptive and frolicsome characters, they increased delusions, deceits and convolutions.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrn bHm inrBau inrMkwr n idKwey
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Nirabhau Nirankaaru N Dikhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nothing was done to have the glimpse of fearless, formless, transcendent, perfect Brahm. Ksatriyas were annihilated

lines.gurmukhi: KqRI mwir sMGwr kir rwmwXx mhwBwrq Bwey
lines.transliteration_english: Khatree Maari Sanghaaru Kari Raamaayan Mahaabhaarat Bhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: And the Ramayan and the Mahabharat epics were composed to please the people.

lines.gurmukhi: kwm kroDu n mwirE loBu mohu AhMkwru n jwey
lines.transliteration_english: Kaam Karodhu N Maariao Lobhu Mohu Ahankaaru N Jaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lust and anger were not deci­mated, nor greed,infatuation and ego were wiped out.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ivxu jnm gvwey ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sangati Vinu Janamu Gavaaay ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the holy congregation, the human birth was lost in vain.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 iSv krq`v

Shabad OS B.translation: Actions of Siva

lines.gurmukhi: iekdUM igAwrh rudR hoie GrbwrI AauDUqu sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ikadoo Giaarah Rudr Hoi Gharabaaree Audhootu Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From one there became eleven Rudrs (Sivas).Even being a householder he was called a recluse.

lines.gurmukhi: jqI sqI sMqoKIAw isD nwQ kir prcw lwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jatee Satee Santokheeaan Sidh Naad Kari Parachaa Laaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He loved celebates, followers of truth, contented ones, Siddhs (the proven ones) and naths, controllers of senses.

lines.gurmukhi: sMinAwsI ds nwv Dir jogI bwrh pMQ clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sanniaasee Das Naanv Dhari Jogee Baarah Pand Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sannyasis adopted ten names and yogis also promulgated their twelve sects.

lines.gurmukhi: iriD isiD iniD rswiexwN qMq mMq cytk vrqwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Rasaainaan Tant Mant Chaytak Varataaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Riddhi, siddhis (miraculous powers), treasures, rasciree (chemical elixir), tantra, mantra and conjurations were introduced.

lines.gurmukhi: mylw kir isvrwq dw krwmwq ivic vwdu vDwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Maylaa Kari Sivaraat Daa Karaamaat Vichi Vaadu Vadhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sivaratri was celebrated as a fair and it increased the debates and the use of miraculous powers.

lines.gurmukhi: posq BMg srwb dw clY ipAwlw Bugq BuMcwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Posat Bhang Saraab Daa Chalai Piaalaa Bhougat Bhounchaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cups of hemp, opium and wine were consumed and enjoyed.

lines.gurmukhi: vjin burgU isM|IAwN sMK nwd rhrwis krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Vajani Buragoo Sineeaan Sankh Naad Raharaasi Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rules for blowing instruments, like singe - and the conch were set.

lines.gurmukhi: Awid purKu Awdysu kir AlKu jgwien AlKu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Kari Alakhu Jagaain Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The primal Lord was saluted and invoked with the shouts of Alakh (the Imperceptible) but no one had perceived the Alakh.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ivx Brim BulwieAw ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Vinu Bharami Bhulaaiaa ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without holy congregation all remained duped by delusions.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 scI rhurIq mukq mwrg

Shabad OS B.translation: The true conduct as way to liberation

lines.gurmukhi: inrMkwr Awkwr kir siqguru gurwN gurU AibnwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Nirankaaru Aakaaru Kari Satiguru Guraan Guroo Abinaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The formless One has assumed form as the true Guru (Nanak Dev) who is the eternal Guru of the Gurus.

lines.gurmukhi: pIrwN pIr vKwxIAY nwQwN nwQ swDsMig vwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Peeraan Peeru Vakhaaneeai Naadaan Naadu Saadhasangi Vaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is known as the pir of pirs(Muslim spiritualists) and that Master of masters resides in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQ clwieAw gurisKu mwieAw ivic audwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pandu Chalaaiaa Gurasikhu Maaiaa Vichi Udaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He promulgated gurmukh panth, the way of Gurmukhs, and the Sikhs of the Guru remain detached even in maya.

lines.gurmukhi: snmuiK imil pMc AwKIAin ibrdu pMc prmysur pwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Sanamoukhi Mili Panch Aakheeani Biradu Panch Paramaysuru Paasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those present themselves before the Guru are known as panches (the eminent ones) and the reputation of such panches  is protected by the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK imil prvwx pMc swDsMgiq scKMf iblwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Mili Paravaan Panch Saadhasangati Sach Khand Bilaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Meeting the Gurmukhs such panches  get accepted and move happily in the holy congregation, the abode of truth.

lines.gurmukhi: gur drsn gur sbd hY inj Gir Bwie Bgiq rhrwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Darasan Gurasabad Hai Nij Ghari Bhaai Bhagati Raharaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The word of the Guru is the glimpse of the Guru and getting settled in one's own self, the discipline of loving devotion is observed.

lines.gurmukhi: imTw bolxu inv clxu Kit Kvwlxu Aws inrwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Mitdaa Bolanu Niv Chalanu Khati Khavaalanu Aas Niraasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: This discipline consists in sweet speech, humble conduct, honest labour, hospitality and in remaining detached among hopes and disappointments.

lines.gurmukhi: sdw shij bYrwgu hY klI kwl AMdir prgwsI
lines.transliteration_english: Sadaa Sahaju Bairaagu Hai Kalee Kaal Andari Paragaasee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Living in equi­poise and indifference is true renunciation in the Kaliyug, the dark age.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq imil bMd KlwsI ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Mili Band Khalaasee ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: Meeting the holy congregation only, one gets liberated from the cycle of transmigration

lines.gurmukhi: 18 gurmuK pIhVI

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukh generation

lines.gurmukhi: nwrI purKu ipAwru hY purK ipAwr kryNdy nwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Naaree Purakhu Piaaru Hai Purakhu Piaar Karayndaa Naaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Woman loves man and man also loves his woman (wife).

lines.gurmukhi: nwir Bqwru sMjog imil puq supuqu kupuqu sYNswrI
lines.transliteration_english: Naari Bhataaru Sanjog Mili Pout Soupoutu Koupoutu Sainsaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: By the union of husband and wife, in this world sons, worthy and unworthy are born.

lines.gurmukhi: purK purKwN jo rcin qy ivrly inrml inrMkwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Purakh Purakhaan Jo Rachani Tay Viralay Niramal Nirankaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who remain absorbed in the Lord God, the male of all the males, are rare pure ones.

lines.gurmukhi: purKhuN purK aupjdw guru qy cylw sbd vIcwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Purakhahu Purakh Oupajadaa Guru Tay Chaylaa Sabad Veechaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: From the primeval Lord, the male (the creative principle) is produced in the same way as by reflection, upon the Word, the true disciple of the Guru is created.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs hoAw pwrshuN guru cylw cylw guxkwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Paaras Hoaa Paarasahu Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Gounakaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Philosopher's stone produces another philosopher's stone i.e. from Guru emerges disciple and the same disciple eventually becomes a virtuous Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK vMsI prmhMsu gurisK swD sy praupkwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Vansee Paramahansu Gurasikh Saadh Say Paraoupakaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs belong to the lineage of the super swans i.e. they are most sacred. The Sikhs of Guru are benevolent like sadhus.

lines.gurmukhi: gurBweI gurBweIAwN swk scw gur vwk juhwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Gurabhaaee Gurabhaaeeaan Saak Sachaa Gur Vaak Juhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru's disciple keeps fraternal relationship with fellow disci­ples and they salute one another with the word of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: pr qnu pr Dnu prhry pr inMdw haumY prhwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Par Tanu Par Dhanu Paraharay Par Nidaa Haoumai Parahaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: They have renounced other's body, other's wealth, slander and ego.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ivthuN bilhwrI ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sangati Vitahu Balihaaree ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto such holy congregation (which brings about such transformation).

lines.gurmukhi: 19 gur is`KI dw swk s`cw swk hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Relationship of the discipleshipof the Guru is the true relation

lines.gurmukhi: 20 siqgur ipAwr

Shabad OS B.translation: Relationship of the discipleshipof the Guru is the true relation

lines.gurmukhi: ipau dwdw pVdwidEN puqR poqw pVpoqw nqw
lines.transliteration_english: Piu Daadaa Parhadaadiahu Pout Potaa Parhapotaa Nataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From father, grand father, great grand father are born son, grand son,great grand son respectively and from great grand son is born simply a relative (natte, having no specific relational name).

lines.gurmukhi: mwN dwdI pVdwdIEN PuPI BYx DIAwN sxKqw
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Daadee Parhadaadeeahu Phuphee Bhain Dheea Sanakhataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The relationship of mother, grand mother, greatgrand mother, father's sister, sister, daughter, and daughter-in-law is also respected.

lines.gurmukhi: nwnw nwnI AwKIAY pVnwnw pVnwnI pqw
lines.transliteration_english: Naanaa Naanee Aakheeai Parhanaanaa Parhanaanee Pataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Maternal grand father and mother and maternal great grand father and mother are also known.

lines.gurmukhi: qwieAw cwcw jwxIAY qweI cwcI mwieAw mqw
lines.transliteration_english: Taaiaa Chaachaa Jaaneeai Taaee Chaachee Maaiaa Mataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Father's elder brother (Taiya) younger brother (chachc7a, their wives (tayi, chachi)et al. also remain absorbed in wordly affairs (maya).

lines.gurmukhi: mwmy qY mwmxIAwN mwsI mwsV dy rMg rqw
lines.transliteration_english: Maamay Tai Maamaaneeaan Maasee Maasarh Dai Rang Rataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mama, mann- (mother's brother and his wife), mast; masa"; (mother's sister and her husband), all look dyed in their own colours.

lines.gurmukhi: mwsV PuPV swk sB shurw ss swlI swlqw
lines.transliteration_english: Maasarh Phupharh Saak Sabh Sahuraa Sas Saalee Saalataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Masar, phuphet (mother's sister's husband and father's sister's husband respectively), father-in-law, mother-in-law, sister-in-law (sali) and brother-in-law (sala) are also close.

lines.gurmukhi: qweyr ipqIeyr mylu imil maulyr PuPyr Avqw
lines.transliteration_english: Taaayr Piteeayr Maylu Mili Maulayr Phuphayr Avataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The relationship of chacha's-in-law and those of the mama-in-law and phaphd-in-law are known as inconvenient relations.

lines.gurmukhi: swNFU kuVm kutMb sB ndI nwv sMjog insqw
lines.transliteration_english: Saaddhoo Kurhamu Koutanb Sabh Nadee Naav Sanjog Nisataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The relation­ship of sister-in-law's husband (Sandhi) and father-in-law of your daughter or son (Kuram) are momentary and fake like those passengers of a boat sitting in a group.

lines.gurmukhi: scw swku nw ivCVY swDsMgiq gur BweI Bqw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachaa Saak N Vichharhai Saadhasangati Gur Bhaaee Bhataa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true relationship is with those brothers who meet in the holy congregation.They never get separated.

lines.gurmukhi: Bog Bugiq ivic jog jugqw ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhog Bhougati Vichi Jog Jougataa ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: Through the holy congrega­tion, the gurmukhs learn the technique of renunciation amidst enjoyments.

lines.gurmukhi: pIau dy nwNh ipAwr quil n PuPI n ipqIey qwey
lines.transliteration_english: Peeu Day Naanh Piaar Tuli Naa Dhudhee Naa Piteeay Taaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The love of father's sister or cousins are not equal to the father's love.

lines.gurmukhi: mwaU hyqu n pujnI hyqu n mwmy mwsI jwey
lines.transliteration_english: Maaoo Haytu N Pujanee Haytu N Maamay Maasee Jaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Love of mother cannot be equalled by the love of the children of maternal uncle and mother's sister.

lines.gurmukhi: AMbwN sDr nw lhY Awx AMbwkVIAwN jy Kwey
lines.transliteration_english: Anbaan Sadhar N Outarai Aani Anbaakarheeaan Jay Khaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: By eating mango blossms the desire for eating mangoes is not fulfilled.

lines.gurmukhi: mUlI pwn ptMqrw vwsu fkwr prgtI Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Moolee Paan Patantaraa Vaasu Dikaaru Paragateeaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The smells of radish leaves and betel are differ­ent and are identified through smell and eructation.

lines.gurmukhi: sUrj cMd n pujnI dIvy lK qwry cmkwey
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraj Chand N Pujanee Deevay Lakh Taaray Chamakaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lacs of lighted lamps and stars cannot compete with the sun and the moon.

lines.gurmukhi: rMg mjIT kusuMB dw sdw sQoeI vys vtwey
lines.transliteration_english: Rang Majeetd Kousounbh Daa Sadaa Sadoee Vaysu Vataaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The colour of madder is steadfast and the colour of safflower changes very soon.

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru quil n imhrvwn mwq ipqw n dyv sbwey
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Tuli N Miharavaan Maat Pitaa N Dayv Sabaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Neither mother and father nor all the gods can be as gracious as the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: ifTy sBy Toik vjwey ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Ditday Sabhay Tdoki Vajaaay ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: All these relations have been thoroughly tested.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 auho hI

Shabad OS B.translation: Love of the true Guru

lines.gurmukhi: mwpy hyqu n pujnI siqgur hyqu sucyq shweI
lines.transliteration_english: Maapay Haytu N Pujanee Satigur Haytu Souchayt Sahaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Love of parents cannot be equal to the love of the true Guru, the bestower of consciousness.

lines.gurmukhi: swh ivswh n pujnI siqgur swhu AQwhu smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Saah Visaah N Pujanee Satigur Saahu Adaahu Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Trust in the bankers cannot match the reliance upon the true Guru who has boundless capacity.

lines.gurmukhi: swihb quil n swihbI siqgur swihb scw sweIN
lines.transliteration_english: Saahib Tuli N Saahibee Satigur Saahib Sachaa Saaeen.

Shabad OS B.translation: Of none's lordship is equal to the Lordship of true Guru. That true Guru is the real master.

lines.gurmukhi: dwqy dwiq n pujnI siqgur dwqw scu diRVweI
lines.transliteration_english: Daatay Daati N Pujanee Satigur Daataa Sachu Drirhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The charities given by others cannot be equal to the charities bestowed by the true Guru because the true Guru bestows steadfastness in the truth.

lines.gurmukhi: vYd n pujin vYdgI siqgur haumY rog imtweI
lines.transliteration_english: Vaid N Pujani Vaidagee Satigur Haoumai Rog Mitaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The treatment of the physicians cannot reach the true physician's treatment because the true Guru cures the disease of egoism.

lines.gurmukhi: dyvI dyv n syv qul siqgur syv sdw suKdweI
lines.transliteration_english: Dayvee Dayv N Sayv Tuli Satigur Sayv Sadaa Soukhadaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Worship of gods and goddesses is also not equal to the constant pleasure-giving worship of the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: swier rqn n pujnI swDsMgiq guir sbdu suBweI
lines.transliteration_english: Saair Ratan N Pujanee Saadhasangati Guri Sabadu Soubhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even jewels of ocean cannot be equated with the holy congregation because the holy congregation is adorned by the word of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: AkQ kQw vfI vifAweI ]21]39]
lines.transliteration_english: Akad Kadaa Vadee Vadiaaee ?21?39?ounataalee?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ineffable is the story o, the grandeur of the true Guru; his glory is great.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: brn brn bhu brn gobMs jYsy eyk hI brn duhy dUD jg jwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Baran Baran Bahu Baran Gobans Jaisay , Ayk Hee Baran Duhay Doodh Jag Jaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the cows are of many breeds and colours, yet the whole world knows that they all yield milk of the same colour.

lines.gurmukhi: Aink pRkwr Pl PUl kY bnwspqI eykY rUp Agin srb mY smwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Anik Prakaar Dhal Dhool Kai Banaasapatee , Aykai Roop Agani Sarab Mai Samaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: There are many species of fruit and flower trees but all carry the same latent fire in them.

lines.gurmukhi: cqur brn pwn cUnw Aau supwrI kwQw Awpw Koie imlq AnUp rUp TwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Chatur Baran Paan Choonaa Au Soupaaree Kaadaa , Aapaa Khoi Milat Anoop Roop Tthaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Four different colours-beetle leaf, Supari (beetle nut), Kattha (extract of the bark of accacia) and lime shed their own colour and merge in each other in a Paan and make beautiful red colour.

lines.gurmukhi: logn mY logwcwr gurmuiK eykMkwr sbd suriq aunmn aunmwnIAY ]39]
lines.transliteration_english: Logan Mai Logaachaar Gurmukhi Aykankaara , Sabad Surati Ounaman Ounamaaneeai ?39?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the Guru-conscious person (Gurmukh) renounces various worldly pleasures and adopts one colour of the formless God. And because of the blessings of his Guru who has taught him to unite with the divine word and his mind, he achieves higher spiritu
